newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan September export orders up 7.11 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan September export orders up 7.11 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Foreign orders for Taiwan goods rose 7.11 percent in September from September 1995 to US$10.513 billion, a monthly record high, the economics ministry said on Monday.
The following is a table of export data in millions of U.S. dollars.
The ministry attributed the record high in monthly orders mainly to rising foreign demand for information and telecommunication products.
Overall orders from the United States rose 3.47 percent to $3.20 billion, with information and telecommunication products accounting for $670 million of the total.
European orders grew 30.89 percent to $1.70 billion, also on rising demand for information and telecommunication products.
Orders from Hong Kong were up 5.40 percent to $1.91 billion, while orders from Japan rose 6.64 percent to $1.41 billion.
Orders for information and telecommunication products rose 28.53 percent to $1.74 billion.
Orders for electronic goods were down 1.63 percent to $1.51 billion, and orders for textile products fell 1.33 percent to $1.34 billion.
Orders for base metal products rose 3.85 percent to $860 million, while those for plastics and rubber products slipped 0.16 percent to $640 million.
Machinery orders were down 1.37 percent to $580 million.
